description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus. As a Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating goals to project stakeholders. Your projects often span offices, time zones and hemispheres, and it's your job to keep all the players coordinated on the project's progress and deadlines.

As a Program Manager, you will plan requirements with internal customers and guide projects through the entire project lifecycle, including managing schedules, identifying risks and dependencies, and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're comfortable explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives and evaluating trade-offs with our engineering partners.

In this role, you will be responsible for the delivery of systems solutions required to scale and support our growing Google Hardware business, which includes integrations with internal systems and SAAS applications and close collaboration with internal teams. This will required excellent coordination and meticulous project tracking. You will learn new domains while driving solutions. Additionally, you will contribute experience with supply chain systems and processes, expertly assessing operational workflows and target application feature development.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 4 years of experience managing projects.
  • 2 years of experience in a supply chain or planning role.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 8 years of work experience, including 6 years of experience in supply chain and/or demand planning.
  • Experience in supply chain planning and fulfillment processes (e.g., demand and supply planning, allocation, fulfillment)..
  • Ability to lead complex operational projects with a cross-functional team.
  • Excellent attention to detail and demonstrated focus on execution.
  • Excellent analytical, problem-solving, time management, and organizational skills.
  • Excellent project management, interpersonal, and written and verbal communication skills.
responsibilities:
• Define comprehensive business requirements, make the business case for applications or features that support our operations, and partner with Engineering to enable these capabilities.
  • Develop effective relationships with user planners to understand their pain points and use cases for improved systems and automation.
  • Lead cross-functional teams and manage multiple simultaneous projects with competing priorities.
  • Be responsible for systems roll-out and change management, including new process definition, user acceptance testing, training, go-live, and adoption. Establish the key success metrics and goals for your applications.
  • Oversee and be willing to be hands on managing hygiene of systems, pipes, dashboards, and support production systems. Serve as systems subject matter expert for troubleshooting and ad hoc efforts across the business and Engineering teams.
title: Program Manager, Demand Planning, Business Systems
